description.en:
The course will study the applicability of biotechnological processes for e.g. the removal of pollution, generation of renewable energy or production of biomass, by exploiting biological processes, and how to integrate these techniques into the modern economy.
Part of the course will be lectures providing basic theoretical background of main topics and in the second part students will work with case-studies to seek solutions for real-life problems.
description.et:
Kursusel uuritakse biotehnoloogiliste protsesside rakendatavust nt. saaste eemaldamisel, taastuvenergia või biomassi tootmisel selleks bioloogilisi protsesse kasutades ning kuidas neid tehnikaid kaasaegsesse majandusse integreerida.
Kursuse üks osa on põhiteemade teoreetilise taustaga loengud ja teises osas tegelevad üliõpilased juhtumianalüüsidega tegeliku elu probleemidele lahenduste otsimiseks.

objectives.en: The aim of course to give an overview of using biotechnology applications for solving environmental problems and engineering of various organisms for their use in the context of bioeconomy.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on anda ülevaade biotehnoloogia rakenduste kasutamisest keskkonnaprobleemide lahendamisel ning erinevate organimide kasutamine bioökonoomikas.

learning_outcomes.en: Students completing the course will gain knowledge in following topics:
learning_outcomes.et: Kursuse läbinud tudengid omandavad järgmised teadmised:

learning_outcomes.en: *	Using various organisms for environmental cleanup and remediation.
learning_outcomes.et: * erienvate organismide kasutamine keskkonna puhastamisel ja parendamisel

learning_outcomes.en: *	Basic principles of wastewater treatment technologies by microorganisms.
learning_outcomes.et: * mikroorganismide abil reovee käitlemise tehnoloogia alused

learning_outcomes.en: *	Use of various organisms for biofuel and biopolymer production.
learning_outcomes.et: * erienvate organismide kasutamine biokütuse ja biopolümeeride tootmisel

learning_outcomes.en: *	Engineering of organisms for efficient energy and resource use.
learning_outcomes.et: * organismide abil energia ja ressursside kasutamise tõhustamine

independent_work.et:
*Preparation for seminar presentations, reading literature.
*Solve the group work exercises, and preparing presentations about group work 
*Reading the lecture notes and written materials for preparation for the exam.

description.et: Preparation for seminar presentations, reading literature. Seminar -20%
Solve the group work exercises, and preparing presentations about group work . Group work -20%
Reading the lecture notes and written materials for preparation for the exam. Exam -60%

grade_preconditions.et:
Successful seminar presentation 
Successful solution to group work exercises
75% attendance to lectures

debt_elimination.et: Two regular exams and one retake

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

name.en: Chair of Colloidal and Environmental Chemistry
Chair of Colloidal and Environmental Chemistry

structural_unit.address:
Nooruse 1
50411 Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.et:
*bioremediation (Veljo Kisand, Ebe Merilo) - 6  (9h)
1 Lecture. Microbial remediation, functional properties of microbial communities, clening technlogies to remove pollutant from soil and aquatic environments- Veljo
1 Lecture. Phytoremediation - use of living plants to clean soils, water etc contaminated with pollutants and genetic engineering to enhance phytoremediation efficiency- Ebe
3 Seminars by students + discussion on the bases of literature
2 Practical group work events

*wasterwater treatment  (Taavo Tenno)- 6 (9h)
1 Lecture. Wastewter treatment principles and microorganisms
1 Lecture. Wasetwater treatment technologies 
1 Lecture. Kinetics of wastewater treatment 
1 Lecture. Modelling of wastewater treatment processes
2 Seminars by students + discussion on the bases of literature

*bioproduction (Livia Matt, Markus Raudkivi) - 7 (10,5h)
1 Lecture Replacing fossil-based economy by bio-based one: everyday chemicals and materials from biomass - Livia 
1 Lecture  Use of various organisms for biofuel and biopolymer production- Markus
1 Lecture Biogas technologies- Markus
1 Lecture Biofuel production -Markus
1 Lecture  Biopolymer production - Lauri
2  Seminars by students + discussion on the bases of literature

*engineering of organisms (Hannes Kollist) -  5 (7.5h)
1 Lecture. Basic principles of photosynthesis, application in engineering optimized plants.
1 Lecture. Basic principles of plant water and mineral use and possibilities for improving these processes.
2 Seminars by students + discussion on the basis of Teaching Tools for Plant Biology.
1 Practical group work 
Brief introduction to few plant-based databases (20 min) after which each student will get a sequence, will identify for which plant gene/protein it belongs and prepare brief overview for this plant gene/protein, its molecular function, physiological role and possible applications.

audience.et: Only for 1st year Bioengineering masters students
